CSR Pelindo III di Bali Tembus Rp7,96 Miliar
05 Nov 2019, 08:48 by Hikmat Raharjo Oetomo


CSR Pelindo III di Bali Tembus Rp7,96 Miliar

KBRN, Pelabuhan Benoa : Salah satu lini Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) yaitu PT. Pelabuhan Indonesia III (Persero) telah menggelontorkan dana tanggung jawab sosial perusahaan (corporate social responsibility/CSR) mencapai Rp7,96 miliar. Angka sebesar itu didistribusikan sepanjang tahun 2018 hingga November 2019 untuk masyarakat sekitar Pelabuhan Benoa (Denpasar) dan Celukan Bawang (Buleleng). CEO Pelindo III Regional Banyuwangi, Bali, Nusa Tenggara (BBN), I Wayan Eka Saputra menjelaskan, bantuan tersebut dibagi dalam dua kategori yaitu Program Bina Lingkungan, dan Program Kemitraan. Dana Program Bina Lingkungan yang telah dikucurkan sebesar Rp5,61 miliar."Program Bina Lingkungan ini untuk membantu kebutuhan sosial masyarakat diberbagai bidang mulai dari pendidikan, kesehatan, hingga budaya, dan lingkungan," jelasnya kepada wartawan di Kantor PT. Pelindo III Cabang Benoa, Selasa (5/11/2019). "Salah satu program bina lingkungan yang dirasakan manfaatnya langsung di Bali adalah beroperasinya 10 unit kendaraan sampah di beberapa Kecamatan di Denpasar diantaranya Denpasar Selatan, Kelurahan Padang Sambian termasuk di Desa Manggis Karang Asem serta semakin meningkatnya kondisi sosial masyarakat di lokasi Desa Adat Panglipuran Bangli setelah mendapatkan bantuan sebesar Rp450 juta berupa pembangunan toilet umum dan balai patok," lanjutnya. Sedangkan untuk Program Kemitraan dana yang sudah diserahkan mencapai Rp2,34 miliar. Dari program tersebut, Pelindo III dikatakan telah memiliki mitra binaan dari usaha kecil dan menengah (UKM) sebanyak 192 unit yang tersebar diseluruh Pulau Dewata. "Selain itu Program Kemitraan Pelindo III yang telah  disalurkan di Bali pada Kamis 27 Juni 2019 lalu, berupa pinjaman lunak sebagai suntikan modal kerja untuk 13 UKM milik warga di sekitar Pelabuhan Benoa yang dikelola Pelindo III. Ada 13 usaha kecil penerima bantuan yang bergerak di bidang perikanan dan jasa perdagangan. Kebanyakan berasal dari Kabupaten Badung dengan total nilai bantuan sebesar Rp1,06 miliar,” ujar mantan GM. Pelindo III Cabang Pelabuhan Benoa tersebut. Wayan Eka lebih lanjut mengatakan, pembangunan sosial, ekonomi masyarakat Pulau Seribu Pura tidak hanya fokus pada optimalisasi kawasan Bali Selatan. Pelindo III disebut memiliki pelabuhan di Bali Utara yakni Celukan Bawang yang berada di Kabupaten Buleleng. "Pelindo III telah menyalurkan Rp940 juta dana PKBL yang diperuntukkan untuk pembangunan sarana pendidikan, ibadah, pemberian sembako gratis, serta yang paling menarik adalah budidaya terumbu karang yang merupakan pertama kali dilakukan di Buleleng," bebernya. “Pengembangan terumbu karang ini kita proyeksikan dapat menjadi salah satu destinasi wisata baru di Bali Utara. Selain menumbuhkan wisata bawah laut di Buleleng yang dapat menarik wisatawan datang, dengan budidaya terumbu karang dapat meningkatkan kualitas lingkungan dan budidaya ikan,” tandas Eka Saputra.

Pelindo III CSR in Bali Reached IDR 7.96 Billion
05 Nov 2019, 08:48 by Hikmat Raharjo Oetomo


Pelindo III CSR in Bali Reached IDR 7.96 Billion

KBRN, Benoa Harbor: One of the lines of State Owned Enterprises (BUMN), namely PT. Pelabuhan Indonesia III (Persero) has disbursed corporate social responsibility (CSR) funds of Rp.7.96 billion. That number is distributed throughout 2018 until November 2019 for the communities around the Ports of Benoa (Denpasar) and Celukan Bawang (Buleleng). Pelindo III Regional CEO of Banyuwangi, Bali, Nusa Tenggara (BBN), I Wayan Eka Saputra explained, the assistance was divided into two categories, namely the Community Development Program and the Partnership Program. "The Community Development Program Fund has disbursed Rp. 5.61 billion." The Community Development Program is to help the social needs of the community in various fields ranging from education, health, to culture, and the environment, "he told reporters at the Office of PT. Pelindo III Benoa Branch, Tuesday (11/05/2019). "One of the direct environmental development programs that is felt directly in Bali is the operation of 10 units of garbage vehicles in several sub-districts in Denpasar including South Denpasar, Padang Sambian Village, including in the Manggis Karang Asem Village and the increasing social conditions of the community in the Panglipuran Bangli Indigenous Village location after obtaining assistance amounting to Rp.450 million in the form of construction of public toilets and peg centers, "he continued. As for the Partnership Program, funds already submitted amounted to Rp2.34 billion. From the program, Pelindo III is said to have 192 fostered partners from small and medium enterprises (SMEs) spread throughout the Island of the Gods. "In addition, the Pelindo III Partnership Program, which was distributed in Bali on Thursday, June 27, 2019, took the form of soft loans as working capital injections for 13 SMEs owned by residents around the Benoa Port managed by Pelindo III. There were 13 small recipient businesses engaged in the field of fisheries and trade services. Most come from Badung Regency with a total aid value of Rp1.06 billion, "said the former GM. Pelindo III of the Benoa Port Branch. Wayan Eka further said, the social, economic development of the people of Seribu Pura Island is not only focused on optimization of the South Bali region. Pelindo III is said to have a port in North Bali namely Celukan Bawang in the Regency of Buleleng. "Pelindo III has channeled Rp. 940 million of PKBL funds which are earmarked for the construction of educational facilities, worship, free food needs, and the most interesting thing is cultivation. "the coral reef which is the first time done in Buleleng," he explained a. "We project this coral reef development to become one of the new tourist destinations in North Bali. Besides growing underwater tourism in Buleleng that can attract tourists to come, by cultivating coral reefs can improve the quality of the environment and fish farming, "said Eka Saputra.
